field_speakers.processed: Dr. Justine Shanti Alexander (Snow Leopard Network, Snow Leopard Trust), Terry Townshend (Paulson Institute), Mei Zhang (WildChina)

field_description.processed: China is home to the largest number of wild snow leopards in the world with the current population estimated to be between 2,000-2,500. Organizations like Snow Leopard Trust and Shan Shui Conservation Center are leading the efforts in pushing conservation forward, including a national park system in the Tibetan Plateau. Join us in speaking with leading snow leopard conservation experts, Dr. Justine Shanti Alexander and Terry Townshend, to hear about the ongoing efforts in China to save these endangered cats.
